result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Sanchez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Pay costs including DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Set up a payment plan within 60 days of release from prison
*Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel A. Sanchez in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:41 am  Case is called.
Cases heard are: 15CT213, 15CM515, 15CM516, 16CM230, 16CF347, 16CF449, 17CF38, 17CF123, and 17CF124.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT213 Count 1 - No Contest
15CM515 Count 1 - No Contest
15CM515 Count 3 - No Contest
15CM516 Count 1 - No Contest
16CF347 Count 1 - No Contest
16CF347 Count 3 - No Contest
16CF449 Count 1 - No Contest
17CF38 Count 1 - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of 15CT213 Count 1, 15CM515 Count 1, 15CM515 Count 3, 15CM516 Count 1, 16CF347 Count 1, 16CF347 Count 3, 16CF449 Count 1, and 17CF38 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:

15CT213 Count 1 - 
75 days Jail 
Concurrent to 16CF347
Pay $350 Fine + Costs
Fine and costs can be taken out of prison account, or set up payment plan within 60 days of release of prison.

15CM515 Count 1 - 
50 days Jail 
Consecutive to 16CF347 and 17CF38.
Pay Fine + Costs totaling $1,807
$26.45 Blood Draw Fee
Fine and costs can be taken out of prison account, or set up payment plan within 60 days of release of prison.
27 months Revocation of License - concurrent with 16CF347, credit for any time revoked administratively
27 months Ignition Interlock Device - concurrent with 16CF347, credit for any time revoked administratively
DOT Assessment and comply with Driver's Safety Plan.

15CM515 Count 3 - 
Pay costs
Fine and costs can be taken out of prison account, or set up payment plan within 60 days of release of prison.

15CM516 Count 1 - 
20 days Jail
Concurrent with 16CF347
Pay costs including $100 Domestic abuse surcharge
Fine and costs can be taken out of prison account, or set up payment plan within 60 days of release of prison.

16CF347 Count 1 - 
Serve determinate sentence of 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System
2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision. 
12 days jail credit.
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Pay Fine + Costs totaling $2,502
$33.33 Blood Draw Fee
Fine and costs can be taken out of prison account, or set up payment plan within 60 days of release of prison.
36 months Revocation of License
36 months Ignition Interlock Device
DOT Assessment and comply with Driver's Safety Plan as a condition of reinstatement (.134).
Comply with any other assessments or counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.

16CF347 Count 3 - 
Pay costs
Fine and costs can be taken out of prison account, or set up payment plan within 60 days of release of prison.

30 days Jail

Pay costs

Defendant Daniel Sanchez in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF347, 16CF449, 16CM230, 15CM515, 15CM516 and 15CT213.

9:19 a.m.  Atty Knaapen calls the case and states the appearances.

Atty Knaapen states that there had been a plea agreement but Atty Drengler had informed the State that he is not able to proceed today.
Atty Drengler indicates that his client has been "shopping" around for private counsel.
Atty Drengler moves the Court to allow him to withdraw as counsel.
Court indicates that a motion to withdraw will need to be provided to the Court for signature.
Defendant indicates that he has spoken with Atty Redfield on 12/06/16.
Court makes additional statements in regards to the cases in front of the Court.

BTC:  Atty Drengler is not allowed to withdraw as of today's date but will need to file a motion to withdraw.
Court will look for a stipulation for substitution of counsel if defendant so chooses to obtain other counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
